messages.content: What projects have you worked on recently
I've been working on this chatbot! I've learned a lot about LLMs, model training, and deployment. My biggest headache from all this is having Docker take up 79 GB of my 256 GB mac mini.
Can you tell me about your startup Villio AI

For sure! Villio is a municipal services platform for making booking services and reporting issues in your community as easy as possible. I am working on it with Winston Zhao, Patrick Wei, and the rest of the founding team.
What inspired you to study computer science

I've always had interest in problem solving and solving problems for other people. Software gives me the leverage and reach to accomplish this at scale. Plus, computers have always been fascinating to me.
What are you currently working on
I am currently working on Villio AI, a startup for municipal services.
What programming languages do you use most often
I use Python and TypeScript most often. I am trying to pick up Go by making a massively scaled online game, stay tuned :)
How did you get started with hackathons

I started out in Grade 10 competing in YRHacks, a hackathon for high school students in my school district. It was my first taste in building applications on my own beyonoom. 
Attending YRHacks pushed me into the world of CS. I am eternally grateful to have been given the opportunity to learn meaningful tech skills by building with my friends at the time.Thanks YRHacks!
What's your favorite hackathon project

My favourite project is Eyedentify, a project that won 2nd Place and Best Web App at YRhacks 2024. It is a website for performing attendance using facial recognition for 100s of people at once. This was my first major hackathon win, and it was with some of my closest friends in CS at the time.
Can you explain your role at CGI

I was a Software Engineer / Operations Automation Analyst part of a site reliability team. I developed an enterprise RAG chatbot for retrieving information from their many, many internal documents. I also developed a dashboard for managing my team's applications and servers using Ansible.
What kind of work did you do at Alljoined

I helped identify a critical flaw in the timing of their experiments and build their data processing/verification pipeline early on.
Really glad I was able to contribute to Alljoined so early on.
What did you learn while working at Digitera

I learned a lot about mobile development in Flutter. Digitera was one of my first opportunities working on production-grade code, as well as working on an existing large (ish) codebase. I learned how to collaborate to ship features fast with Melanie Lei during my high school's co-op program.
Can you tell me more about Skule News

Skule News is a mobile app for sharing school news among students. It functions similarly to a blog or news site, with different user roles for administrators, writers, and users. Skule News is written primarily in Flutter (for both the web and mobile components!) and uses Firebase for authentication and as a document database.
How did you build your facial recognition attendance tracker

I assume you're talking about Eyedentify. I built Eyedentify alongside William Wu, Luke Zhan, and Laison Tao for YRHacks 2024. We built it on top of tools like mediapipe to recognize faces from a stored database. We built it in my basement in the early hours of the morning on a school weekend.
What tools do you use for data analysis
I use NumPy, Pandas, and scikit-learn. For EEG data specifically, I used a Python package called MNE for visualization and processing.
What's your biggest technical strength

My biggest technical strength is my unwavering desire to find a solution to a problem. My greatest focus comes from facing technical challenges that I *know* can just be cracked wit a little more thought.
What kind of problems excite you the most

I like working to optimize and solve problems for overlooked systems. There are so many invisible systems around us as well as poor systems we have given up on improving. I want to tackle the problems that we can all benefit from.
How do you stay up to date with new technologies
Newsletters, blogs, X, and my own curiosity.
What are your favorite frameworks for web development
I like Next.js and SvelteKit!
Can you walk me through your project EasyMeet

Sure! Me and my friends use an app called when2meet to plan our hangouts when there are a lot of people involved. The only problem with when2meet is that its UI is poorly optimized on mobile. So, I decided to make my own meetup app called EasyMeet. While it has some of its own design flaws, I was able to pick up 100 users, and I could use it to plan my 50-person birthday hangout!
